taskmodule.experiment
Interface IExperiment

public interface IExperiment

Author:
Assaf Israel & Eli Nazarov (Group 3, SE Project)

Method Summary
 void addTask(ITask task)
          Adds the given task to the experiment.
 void disable()
          Stops the experiment.
 void enable()
          Activates the experiment.
 IDataModel getData()
          Returns the recorded activities that are part of at least one task in the experiment.
 java.lang.String getName()
          Returns the name of the experiment.

          Returns a set of tasks currently in the experiment.
 

Method Detail

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Returns the name of the experiment.

Returns:
Experiment name

addTask

void addTask(ITask task)
Adds the given task to the experiment.

Parameters:
task - Task to be added.

getTasks

java.util.Set<ITask> getTasks()
Returns a set of tasks currently in the experiment.

Returns:
Set of tasks in the experiment.

enable

void enable()
Activates the experiment. After invocation all activities that happen in the system and are part of at least one task will be recorded.

disable

void disable()
Stops the experiment. After invocation if an activity that is part of at least one task happened it won't be recorded.

getData

IDataModel getData()
                   throws TaskModuleException
Returns the recorded activities that are part of at least one task in the experiment.

Returns:
IDataModel - Recorded data object.
Throws:
TaskModuleException
